Reviews.Title: “Another memory of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jjdr62
Reviews.Content: My friends & I recenly stayed at Joyce Hotel. At first, my thought was, this was "out" of location (for me). Well, there's always a taxi and if you're just a few days in Paris, it isn't that bad. From the Opera, its just a few minutes walk. Healthy, I would say! Service was good. Met Mr. Samuel from the Front Desk. He was so kind & helpful and I think he has the quality of a good Public Relations Officer and/or Hotel Manager. Keep it up, Mr. Samuel! And thank you for everything. Of course, the other staffs were also good & helpful. They speak & understand English otherwise we would have tried our best with sign language ^_^ Well, me & my friends did have a great time staying at your hotel.Till next time...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreekAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Nice and fancy hotel for a reasonable price. Nicely decorated rooms, which are not too large, but which hotelrooms are sizable in Paris? Breakfast buffet is ok, nothing fancy, would not recommend to include it if you have the option not to include it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: SJSLondon2012
Reviews.Content: I would definitely return to Hotel Joyce or stay at another Astotel hotel in Paris. Loved the quirky designs in Reception, cafe and common areas. Room was very comfortable and clean. And the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it's good for Paris but...”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe Z
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel because of the rate, the position and the good trip advisor reviews. THe hotel looks good when you arrive, everything is designed to look good... BUT: the rooms on the side of the street are not enough insulated from the noise of the road, I good hear clearly every rev on each engine. I had a shower and the floor of the bathroom was looking like a lake. The breakfast is not worth the money you pay for it (if you pay it explicitly, it's "free" booking on the hotel's website). Those who liked it, don't know what a good croissant is. I don't want to point only megative points. what is good: very friendly stuff even if some of them speak only french, nice looking everthing even if not always practical (see above), free soft drinks bar.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hannah C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Joyce just a few days back and I cannot express how much my friends and I enjoyed our experience. Not only was the hotel in a great location- right next to the Opera House and wonderful cafes and chocolate shops, but the helpfulness and consideration of the staff was stellar. The people at the front desk were always willing and happy to help us find great places to go and sites to see. A particular staff member, Samuel, was one that made our stay extremely enjoyable. Again, I highly recommend a stay at Joyce Hotel. Everything about our stay at this place was golden, and matched the beauty and fun of Paris with an easy perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudeSibelius
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed, clean. Small room, but that's what we'd expect in Paris. Enough hanging space for a weekend away but might not be enough for a week. Room was quiet as even though we were at the front of the hotel, it is not on a main street. The only negative was the bathroom design: only a very small space to put our own toiletries and the shower leaked out under the door, but good water pressure. 15 min walk from Montmartre / Sacre Coeur and 30 mins from the Louvre. Within walking distance of a number of metro stations. Free nibbles and soft drinks all day which was a lovely touch (although the drinks weren't chilled which would have been nice). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel. Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tarek M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I this a very pleasant easy going hotel. The hotel atmosphere is great and interior design is very nice. The room was spacious, clean and convenient. The breakfast could be improved and the room we stayed in on the ground floor could do with better ventilation. We would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be going back again. The staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service ever.”
Reviews.Author: akay03
Reviews.Content: Before I had even stayed the night I had the best customer service experience of my life! The employees behind the desk went out of his way to accommodate us and helped us tourists out of a very helpless situation. The hotel is underrated at 3 stars - it is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are very clean and very cute! I'd highly recommend staying!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Thommes81
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend this hotel for a city trip to Paris. Good location, friendly staff! A little expensive maybe (breakfast comes extra)..

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Paris with fantastic hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pierrette777
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one overnight on 23.12.2011. We booked last minute and did check room capacity before. We were travelling in Europe with our 3 year old daughter and used to share bed with her during the trip. Upon arrival we were told that it would not be possible to stay in the standart room even sharing the bed. The person checked if the larger suite was available for the night. Price for the night 550 EUR and we got it with no extra as Christmas present! That was a wonderful and memorable present we had! We enjoyed the fabulous views on the Eiffel Tower and Paris roofs. The decor is stylish and well designed. We loved it so much. The breakfast was excellent and the design amazing. We want to thank the staff for its warm hospitality and responsivness upon our arrival. Thank you so much. Isabelle, Viktor and Charlotte

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianne T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. This hotel was an excellent location for all the sights and ideally situated for the Montmartre district and for Sacre-Coeur. We had no issues with the room at all. Whilst the rooms are small they should be what you expect in Paris as like any Capital city space is at a premium. The free soft drinks and snacks from 2pm each day was a nice thought. Breakfast was a bit disorganised and the two ladies could do with having more glasses and bowls to hand. Also could do with having the tables cleared quicker for reuse. We would definitely use this hotel again if we ever went to Paris. And England won the Rugby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HerbertDouglas
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were a little overwhelmed with the number of hotels to choose from in Paris and so chose this at the last minute, but we were thrilled with it. We'd debated about going to Joyce's sister hotel opposite which is a little cheaper but are so pleased we went with Joyce. The best things about Joyce Hotel are: - Very good and friendly staff even if clearly a little run off their feet. - Cleanliness - Comfortable beds: we have a special mattress at home and so rarely achieve a good night's sleep when away but the bed at Joyce was incredibly comfortable - Design: we're keen on contemporary design and this hotel was a source of inspiration. (The helpful staff even told us where we could purchase the lighting and wall paper from). - Open bar; it's a nice touch considering most hotels rip you off for a simple drink.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “My first experience at Joyce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo H
Reviews.Content: Although I've spent one day at Joyce Hotel, I had opportunity to experience something very different when comparing this hotel to other places at the same level. Room reserved to my staying was well organized and clean. The design is light. The staff fully support guests in any matter of information - actually the front desk staff really makes the difference as they're responsible for guest reception and for the first hotel impression.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: harmsworth
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - but next time we will try to stay more centrally as a long walk down to the Seine and most of the sights. room and bathroom both a good size with a balcony over-looking a quiet back street. bathroom extractor fan and bedside light did not work - both reported but not fixed. Staff very friendly - and the "open bar" in the afternoon is a great idea - the atrium is a lovely place to sit. I would not have wanted to have a room looking into the courtyard Very "designer" in decoration - as a middle aged couple we felt that we were not really cool enough to stay there

Reviews.Title: “" Nice Hotel in Paris "”
Reviews.Author: SeokHoong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights with my girl friend. Hotel room on 5th Floor is of good size, esp the bathroom. Clean and comfortable and quiet room. Samuel at Reception recommended great restaurant, Cafe Jadis near hotel, with good French food and good price, which we dined twice during our trip. Hotel Open bar downstairs from 2pm to 2am, is a great concept with free juices, soft drinks, tea , coffee, water, snacks. Also good Japanese restaurant nearby for a change. Good free wifi at Hotel. Breakfast at Hotel could improve with some eggs / bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Contempoary bliss in a tradional city.”
Reviews.Author: thesaintlondon
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this hotel Right in the centre of it all, but so quiet and serene.love the modern feel of the place and the rooms are lovely - epecially the big bathroom. The breakfast/ cafe room was my favourite place to be... Atrium and all. Staff are very friendly and will go out of their way to help with directions ect. Will definetly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful journey”
Reviews.Author: NadezdaE
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband at this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is also chosen for reviews. Joyce Hotel met all our expectations. Located on a quiet street, away from the tourist trails. You can relax and sleep in a comfortable bed after a day of walking. Room on the 5th floor of a small but very cozy and beautiful. Two large windows overlook the large terrace with trees. The balcony offers a wonderful view over the rooftops of Paris. It's very romantic! Before the foot of Montmartre 5-7 minutes. Subway is also located nearby, so get to the center for 10-15 minutes. The hotel staff is very friendly and welcoming. This is our first romantic trip to Paris, and it was truly memorable! The next time you stop at the Joyce Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Free "bar" is a great thing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a very friendly staff. Only tiny thing not so nice was that the majority of the rooms have windows to a narrow backyard. Gives you an exellent sleep but feels a little claustrophobic. Ask for a room with a window towards a street.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: Leonid R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Joyce for 3 nights at the end of February . The hotel exceeded all our expectations, particularly as it is only a 3 star! Service was excellent and all staff we're only too happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but otherwise perfect”
Reviews.Author: Arnwood
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a few days in Paris, where I stayed at Hotel Joyce. The positives: very friendly, helpful staff; the hotel is very clean and well decorated; the breakfast buffet was perfect; free wi-fi; good location The only negative: the room was small. Not tiny, but certainly not big. Having said that, I'd definitely stay at Hotel Joyce the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Joyce for 2 nights at the start of February to celebrate my birthday. The hotel exceeded all our expectations, particularly as it is only a 3 star! Service was excellent and all staff we're only too happy to help. The room was spotless and really comfortable. We loved the quirky design of the hotel and it is in a great location close to the metro. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here and we are already looking at going back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: axel669
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room wich was very quite. Good location of the hotel. Helpful multilingual stay. The breakfast was OK with fresh Croissants and good coffee, what can you expect more in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel but breakfast service was not attentive and terrible”
Reviews.Author: PalmersLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok, the room was a little too warm, so I had to open the window when go to sleep (we stayed there in December). During the breakfast time it was difficult to find a place as it was too busy and the staff did not manage to serve all guests properly at all. We were waiting for about 10 mins with 2 other couples behind us. There were empty tables but the staff just did not in any hurry to set them up to accommodate those guests in waiting. So after 10 mins of waiting, we thought we just go to sit down at one of the table. The staff eventually came to tidy up the table but did not ask if we want coffee or tea. We had to ask several times to get them bring a pot of coffee. We both order coffee, should have 2 pots or a bigger pot but after some waiting, they bring out a pot which only filled up a cup and a half. I saw the other couple who came in just after us only got their coffee nearly the end of their breakfast. And the staff in the breakfast service, not only not attentive but also try to avoid any eye contact and made no welcome "hello" or "good morning" greeting to us and guests behind us.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget find”
Reviews.Author: Eddie M
Reviews.Content: For the price ...fantastic place a great find.. Friendly staff... Clean modern design.. Good continental breakfast .. No alcohol ...but free soft drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and and service”
Reviews.Author: ashbanana
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the great reviews and somewhat lower price. It was definitely a great decision. The rooms are small, but clean and cute. Despite the small beds, its perfect! The location is very convenient, walkable to downtown if you dont mind longer walks, and 5 minutes to the metro! Theres also a bus line that drives right by and goes to major sites.The breakfast is good and all of the employees were extremely helpful with anything we needed - made dinner reservations, let us check in early, and got us a shuttle to the airport. Great place and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: MiEs26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my business trip. I booked the suite room at the 6th floor. The room was big and very comfortable, the bed are a bit small, when you are visiting with 2 people. What I missed were Dutch tv channels, there were al kind of channels to choose but notting from Holland. Breakfast was good and incl. the price. The staff was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “All that you might need from a Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaChirilescu
Reviews.Content: The location is good, in the heart of Montmartre. The design of the hotel, both rooms and communal spaces is gorgeous, I love it. The rooms are quite, with pleasant atmosphere. The breakfast includes everything: 3 types of croissants, cereals, fresh fruits, vegetables, colds cuts, a couple types of cheese. I strongly recommend. Free wi-fi and friendly stuff as a bonus. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, great value!”
Reviews.Author: markpilks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend break. About 20 mins walk from Gard du Nord. Less than 5 mins from Saint George and Pigalle metro stations so very well connected and only 10 mins walk from Montmatre. Free wifi, friendly check-in staff, great breakfast included in price. Has a boutique feel. Rooms are great. Beds are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Our french holidays in January”
Reviews.Author: Larisa K
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I've stayed with my daughter at the hotel Joyce. The room was small, but very comfortable and always clean and with good sound insulation. Breakfasts were delicious with fine French pastries. Pleasant impression left the hotel staff, especially receptionist Samuel. Thank you for our French holidays in January.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis__Cook
Reviews.Content: Une nuit, 26-27.12.2011. Arrivée à l'hôtel, réceptionniste très sympathique, décor magnifique. Les chambres sont très propres, la salle de bain tout à fait agréable, climatisation, lit confortable, pas de bruit. L'hôtel propose un open-bar à presque toute heure, où sont proposées des canettes de différentes boissons, ainsi que quelques chips, crackers, etc. La salle de déjeuner-bar est d'un design très particulier mais vraiment génial. Wifi gratuit. Définitivement un hôtel à retenir dans vos choix.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, for Paris”
Reviews.Author: 13inky
Reviews.Content: This was a great find for a Paris hotel. 3 night stay. They do what they do very well. The room was quite spacious for the star rating and price, it was clean, well kept-up and the little extras were great value adds. The breakfast is plentiful and the staff is courteous and helpful. The option of a free hot drink whenever you wanted it was fantastic, and saves you quite a few euros! The evening snacks were also a nice touch. Would definitely recommend to a friend on a budget. Easy access to shopping districts, and close to the metro, although you do need to transfer to other lines. Btw, Hotel Montarassa is literally right across the street, if you're torn between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FrenchmaninLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Joyce Hotel for 1 night over Christmas with my wife. Hotel located in a fairly quiet street near Pigalle (red light district). Rooms overlooking the street are therefore not noisy at all. Public transports (bus and underground) are a 5-mn walk away. For shoppers, Galeries Lafayette Dpt store is just 10 mns away. Hotel personnel very friendly and helpful. Our room (superior-304) was clean (though not very spacious when you have large suitcases, which was not our case fortunately) and bed comfortable. The bathroom is also clean, not very large though. Buffet breakfast is fine, but lacks a toaster. Overall experience very satisfactory, very good value for money (we paid EUR 134 breakfast inc).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKPLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a very quirky yet classy Parisian feel to it. Hatem at reception was always helpful and very friendly - nothing was too much trouble. Very close to the Metro station and a short walk away from Galeries Lafayette. Room was cosy, comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was simple but lovely and the complimentary drinks and snacks throughout the day were a great bonus. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy F
Reviews.Content: This wonderful boutique hotel is tucked away in a quiet neighbor but is located close to the Paris action! A short walk to the Paris Opera, Moulin Rouge, and Montmarte with great access to multiple Metro stops. Cozy, clean, and comfy, the Joyce Hotel has the perfect mix of traditional and modern decor. Our room gave us the sense of a posh, Parisian apartment. Free wifi, continental breakfast and snacks/beverages available throughout the day were some of the amenities we relied on. Overwhelming the strength of this hotel was the helpful and knowledgeable staff. They helped us plan our city excursions, helping us navigate the metro and giving us great insider tips. By far their recommendations for neighbor dining made our experience exceptional. We found the places that they sent us to greeted us as valued friends. Away from the tourist traps we discovered the Paris that the locals know and love. When we return to Paris, the Joyce will be our first destination and our home base throughout our stay!

Reviews.Title: “long week-end a Paris”
Reviews.Author: fabio19781966
Reviews.Content: I still cannot figure out how a 3 stars hotel can be as good, especially in Paris. If you are an experienced traveler you know very well that Paris is a rather difficult place where you find a relatively affordable hotel that offers a certain level of comfort. Joyce has been highly satisfactory on every count (I have slept in too many bad hotels in Paris!). Facilities at Joyce are spotless and you get them all at once in Paris solely in much more expensive hotels. The staff is super friendly. When I checked in it was late at night. Generally in Paris you would be received by an aloof and disinterested attendant who would have checked you as fast as he could in order to get back to his TV room. At Joyce I was received by Samuel who was at Midnight as sparkling as only an attendant at the concierge of George V at 10H00 in the morning could be! He helped me in every way he could. Another day somebody else, as friendly and efficient,was so kind to print my flight boarding card. And he did it so fast! Almost too fast for myself! Furthermore I was very surprised that the cleaning ladies were also very friendly and collaborative (and we all know how hard they can turn into hell your staying in a hotel if they are not!). The breakfast has been excellent, in every detail. For instance: the orange juice is freshly squeezed and not the horrid industrial one. Jam was not served in little awful plastic packages (like it happens also in even more expensive hotels than this!) but in lovely jars and of superb choice (Bonne Maman!). The bed is sublime, with great linens and pillows. The TV screen is big and spotless, with so many channels available and all shown at highest picture quality. Bathroom is excellent, and again full of thoughtful details. How often we experience in hotels that: 1) there are not enough hooks or racks for the towels 2) not enough surfaces for little bags and our own stuff 3) the shower tap is either too complicated or the tap is too low or the curtain sticks on your skin or whatever 4) the detergents and shampoos are bad and never enough. At the Joyce it is not like that, it looks as if somebody has been thinking thoroughly about all the things to avoid when conceiving an ideal bathroom! The internet connection is free and really accessible. Many hotels promise free internet connection and then it is either too slow, or you got to call for assistance and so on. At Joyce it works straight away. The wardrobe spaces are generously thought as well as the safe which can contain a lap top. I mean I could go on and on with examples. I was totally enthusiastic to find such a satisfactory hotel and I wish I could talk to the person who conceived the hotel. He clearly understood that being generous to the clients and coaching the staff in a way that they really and profoundly understand what real service is , is simply better for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, perfect mattress”
Reviews.Author: Mcisgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monterosa only a few weeks after the opening (Jan 2010) and we book our room with special discount. We find the stuff, very helpful and friendly and our room was always clean and tidy. The breakfast buffet was a bit poor and we only had internet access at lobby, not at our room, but as we told this were only temporary. All of the amenities ware top quality, the room and all common areas are really stylish but the best was the mattress. After a hard day at Paris, we come back to the most relaxing bed ever found at a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: M_BR1986
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a weekend in Paris. Excellent location close to the Metro, very hepful staff, good breakfast. Best value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing would recomend round the clock!”
Reviews.Author: Jamesblann
Reviews.Content: Every thing was brill, from the service at the desk, the rooms, the decor and the breakfast! Stayed for 2 nights, we had a super comfy bed, its in a great location which we walk to the louvre from it's not a short walk but it was a much berrter way of seeing the city! The staff were verry helpful and could not have done more to help us! The decor of joyce was amazing, the pics do not do justice! Dont get me wrong the pics look good, but its way better in person! As you can tell my girlfriend and i were verry happy with this hoel and will go back shortly!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel special, come here!”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door, the staff made us feel like we were their number one clients. My husband and I stayed with our 5 month old daughter and they prepared a cirb in our room before we even arrived. They were extrememely friendly and helpfull in every way! The top floor rooms have a typical Parisian view (pretty rooftops). The entire hotel was meticulously clean and the INCLUDED breakfast was generous and diversified. From the free snacks and coffee (anytime) to the concierge calling our airline for us, we were grateful to have chosen this adorable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay very well situated”
Reviews.Author: parcifalcna
Reviews.Content: After a busy Conference in Mandelieu it aws nice to be able to get the heart of Paris at the Joyce Hotel a recent boutique hotel situated on a quiet street in the IX arrondissment. My daughter lives nearby hence the choice of that Hotel. It is fantastically well located and close to the Metro st George and has a good breakfast formula and very comfortable bed and neat rooms. The night manager Samuel was exceptionally attentive to our needs and fixed a minor annoying beeping sound from the safe located in our room. The service was excellent and the staff very courteous. I have stayed there now twice and plan to go there again. You can easily walk to the the Grand Magazins for a hectic shopping experience or go to have a nice tea and cake at La Duree on the Madeleine. There is also an outstanding little Bakery close by the Hotel on the Rue des Martyrs in case you craved for a nice mille feuilles or croissant. The shuttle to CDG was seemless and not too far of a ride.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, quiet area”
Reviews.Author: NIRunaway
Reviews.Content: Location , location, location. Agree with previous reviews this is a good hotel, comfortable, clean,with a lavish breakfast. Free Wifi. Helpful staff. We spent 5 nights there. No restaurant so we ate on at Les Comediens -good French food and attentive staff but somewhat pricey. A good deal to be had at les Deux Theatres , three course meal and wine with sparkling aperitif all for 39 Euros per person. For a quiet drink or simple French meal the bar on the corner-Le Boeuf a la Mode 32 rue la Bruyere- can be recommended

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rex_raccoon
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor on Paris hotels that weren't too expensive, we decided on the Joyce Hotel. Service: Excellent - from the concierge / front desk to the wait staff, all were impeccably polite, cheerful and helpful when we were asking for directions to get to the Versailles, subway stations, booking a airport shuttle bus for us etc. Room: We already knew that Paris hotels were small, so we weren't taken aback. In fact, the room size we felt, while it could not be described as large, was definitely decent. The bathroom with shower was ok too. We had one big luggage between the two of us, that fit into a corner so it was just fine. After all, who spends much time in the hotel room in Paris? The bed however, was smaller than a queen, we found it a bit of a squeeze but still manageable. Now, the elevator however, has got to be the smallest elevator we've ever seen in our lives. It's a horizontal rectangular lift, which could fit four slim people without luggage. The stairs were small and spiral - so suggest that you don't haul your luggage up unless it's small, light or can be carried on your shoulders. Decor: The room and hotel is really lovely - nicely designed and quite artistic too. Perks: Free breakfast (mostly cold stuff like cereals, ham, cheese, breads, yoghurt, fruit - but good enough and definitely filling even for a guy) and free wi-fi. Every day after 2pm, there was an open bar where you could sit and help yourself to drinks (soft drinks, fruit juices, water) and some finger food (cherry tomatoes, crackers, chocolate biscuits). Good enough if you want to have a brief respite from the Parisian heat. Location: Walking distance to two subway stations - Pigalle and St Georges. Further away are the stations near the Galleries LaFayette, we could also walk to the Gare St Lazare, which is a train station where you can take a 25-min train to Versailles. From the Gare du Nord, where we arrived in Paris, it was tough taking the train to the hotel as it involved changing trains and going up and down staircases (poor hubby had to lug the luggage) - so maybe invest in a taxi if necessary. It is also walking distance to the Moulin Rouge. There are a couple of small mini-marts around the area to buy bottled water etc - there are also some eateries around the area, though we enjoyed the La Fayette Gourmet which we walked to. All in all, a value for money hotel - only 199 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Top level service with true empathy”
Reviews.Author: Nir S
Reviews.Content: I want to share with you my little experience with this great Hotel to try to transfer you a little bit the unique level of service. During my stay in the hotel (Sep 21-25th) I was very sick with strong fever for the first 3 days. The hotel Director personally take care for all my needs not only in a professional way, but, and most important, with patient and true empathy ! This kind of attitude and service helped me to overcome the illness easily and faster and sweeten the pill a little bit. Such a service should be complimented and applauded !

Reviews.Title: “Parisian style and charm”
Reviews.Author: 234charlie003
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed, upgraded and given a bottle of champagne in honour of our 30th wedding anniversary! Thank you to the wonderful staff at the Joyce Hotel for making my suprise stay in your beatuiful city so romantic and magical. Our room was clean and comfortable with stylish decor. Breakfast was presented well with understated professionalism. Staff knowlegeable and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, ideal for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Dogcoat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the web and apart from the booking agent stating I wanted a twin room it was perfect. The hotel is not large in size, but every room is spacious, and has thick doors which keep corridor noise down. The rooms are bright and clean, we had a room on the 5th floor with views towards the Opera House, I would suggest having a room which does not look over the rod, it could be bit noisy at night, our room was quiet, really quiet, wouldn't know I was in a city. Bathroom was clean, with new towels, shower head was a bit small, and having a shower did cause the floor to get a bit wet. Free Wifi, TV channels 40 ish,English ones are news channels, iphone docking station in radio The hotel does a very querky thing, in that from 2pm they have an open coffee and soft drink bar, which goes through to late, found it great coming back after dinner, that we could get a bottle of water and a hot chocolate. Breakfast is buffet continental, very much help yourself, the dining room has chairs made from car seats, spent the breakfast each day trying to work out what car the seat came from, got a BMW, an american car (seats were very soft). Eat as much as you want. The main shopping area is about 10 mins walk, Moulin Rouge is about 15mins away in a rather seedy area, lots of kinky shops around it, bit disappointed by that area. Will defineatley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Careful When Booking”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithnise
Reviews.Content: This is short account of the trouble we had with this hotel chain in Paris....We booked this particular hotel well, well in advance to lock in a price,and based on the positive reviews from trip advisor and another travel sites on the web. We did not take take the rate that could not be changed, but the flexible rate that was discounted if you booked more than 3 nights. It turns out it was not very flexible after all!!! 2 weeks before our trip the cruise line changed our flight dates into Paris, and we needed to cancel 2 of our days, but keep 3 days at the hotel. When I emailed the hotel to cancel they stated that I would have to make a new reservation, and the rate was going to be higher. I did not understand this as I was keeping 3 of the days as per the reservation. They would not honor their rate, so I went to their sister hotel Palm Opera which did honor the discount rate! You can read my review on that hotel, but I am writing this review to say that there was no reason that they should not have honored our reservation. We already had the dates, but needed to cancel 2 days because of flight changes. We already had a reservation with this hotel! If we would have paid in advance we would not have been able to cancel at all, so I really don't see the point in a flexible rate guarantee if they are not going to honor it! So be careful when booking! The reviews looked wonderful, but I cannot comment on the hotel itself due to the problems we encountered with the booking!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Joyce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IzziB
Reviews.Content: Just spend a long weekend in Paris and have been staying at Joyce Hotel in the Pigalle area. Joyce hotel is a charming little hotel, with a very helpful and pleasant staff, special thanks to Kaled & Hachem (sorry not sure how to spell it right) but all the other staff were nice & friendly as well. People are always ready to help you with directions, subways, booking reservations.. etc French buffet breakfast was wonderful: French baguette, ham & cheese, fruits, yogurt, eggs, cereals .. However, don’t expect a fat & greasy British/German breakfast with sausages, bacon & potatoes or you will be disappointed. Hotel also proposes snacks throughout the days: chips, olives, water & all kind of complimentary drinks which was nice after a long day walking all over the city. Rooms were not big but very clean and comfortable. We had a superior room with a bathtub.. which was nice after long walking days in Paris but when we tried to shower, the water was leaking all over the bathroom floor which is the only minor thing I have to report. Also don’t plan to come here with huge suitcase as the lift is tiny but very Parisian! We had some good laugh in and with that lift! I can only recommend this charming hotel with wonderful staff and will be staying here if I come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kelfon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great place. If you plan your stay in Paris strategically you'll know what I am talking about. This is my second Paris stay and staying on this side of the bank is a completely different feel than the other. My focus this time is shopping...Galleries Layfayette and buying little treats such as Pierre Hermes...etc... I am staying here at the peak time in Paris and this place is great bang for your buck. The breakfast here has great variety and if you been to paris before at a boutique hotel you know what I am talking about. For cullinary knowlege please consult with Samuel. He knows what he's talking about, but more importantly he can get you in where you want. For a man with asthma he's got great tenacity for telling you stories inhaler or no inhaler, if you're smart you'd take notes. But the one thing that make this hotel memorable is the people working there. Like with food you eat with your eyes first, but its only going to be good if you have the right people to execute it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at which I hope to stay again someday”
Reviews.Author: radballen
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous boutique hotel at a great price in the 9e arrondissement. Along with the wonderfully minimalist, creative room design and great bathroom(!), the free continental breakfast was excellent. This was a great home base for our quick two day trip to Paris. I would definitely stay here again. I miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel, traveling on business with my son. We arrived early and the hotel graciously stored our bags. The staff was friendly and English speaking. Our room was clean and very classy, a modern Parisian feel. The breakfast was outstanding - great array of fruits, breads, cereals, juices, and cheeses. The only reason I did not give this hotel an excellent rating was the location was a bit lacking, yet a lot of street noise. There was not much going on where it is located - I would have stayed there again if not for this. Pigalle is a few blocks away but I found that area a little seedy. It was near a Metro station however.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun”
Reviews.Author: Horsekeeper
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel with a sense of design humour about it from the bank of leather car seats (complete with seat belts) down one side of the breakfast/bar area, to the strange mirrors, and the wall decorations in the small but perfectly adequate bedrooms. The hotel is on a quiet side street, a very short walk from the metro. Staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfasts are OK and there are complementary soft drinks and snacks available from the bar - so would be good if travelling with family too.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: RuiQueiros
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights staying at the Joyce Hotel. All I can say is that we worship the Lacal. The room is not big but has plenty of space and super comfortable. Is very well located, staff is five star, always willing to help and advise in addition to always have a smile;) Breakfast is very good and in addition has open bar 24 hours a day. A hotel that we recommend and we hope to be housed in a forthcoming visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jayoni
Reviews.Content: My daughters (19 and 15), my mother and I stayed at the Joyce Hotel in early July. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is located on a quiet street but it is a short walk to a busy shopping district and The St. Lazare train station. The complimentary breakfast, snack/beverage bar and solarium eating area were great! The staff will open bottles of wine that you have purchased to drink in the comfort of this eating area. I cannot give enough praise to the front desk staff. They helped us find our way around Paris and beyond and gave us many helpful hints. The upper floors are reached by a tricky spiral staircase but an elevator is available. Coline was wonderful! I'd recommend this hotel and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it and will come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: od1983
Reviews.Content: I am in the middle of a Euro trip with my sister and chose to stay at the Joyce Hotel while we were visiting Paris. We stayed in Paris for 4 nights and absolutely enjoyed everything in the hotel. The service by the staff was EXCELLENT. We were well attended to by the staff especially the night staff Samuel who went WAY over and above his job to ensure that our stay surpassed our expectations. He helped enjoy Paris as both a tourist and as a local and helped us get around the city via metro. We also had assistance from Khalid who was great to suggest many trendy and local restaurants, clubs and bars. We stayed in room 302 and had two twin beds, a good size very clean wonderful bathroom, AC, TV, and a window that opens up. The beds were comfortable and the blankets were warm. Our room was very modern and cosy yet there is not much of a view as our room faces a brick wall yet they have decorated the wall so it is not an eye sore and you can look straight down into the dining area lounge on the main floor which was cool because we could see what was being served for breakfast and decide if we wanted to eat or not. The hotel offered free WiFi throughout the hotel including in our room, many channels on the TV, an alarm clock with an iPod dock, reading lamps, hangers in the closet, hooks for out jackets behind the doors, clean towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap and a shower cap. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. It is on a very quiet street yet around the corner was the hustle and bustle of the city. We were in the Opera District and 5 minutes walking distance from Galleries Lafayette and many bars, clubs and restaurants. We were also walking distance from the Metro and was able to get to any tourist location such as the Eiffel Tower, La Louvre and Chateau De Versailles in no time. The best thing about the hotel was the fact that there was free WiFi which was EXTREMELY COVENIENT, the staff, the decor and the unlimited non-alcoholic drinks and breakfast in the morning. If I have to choose something, the least thing liked about the hotel was the lack of an in room iron or mini fridge and the fact that I had to obtain a new password for the WiFi every day from the front desk. (It was for security purposes which is understandable.) Overall my experience at the Joyce Hotel was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, deserted neighborhood - Will not recommend..”
Reviews.Author: joasiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in May '11. The decor was great and the place clean. However, I felt I was paying way too much at an average of 240 Euros a night. (There were promotional rates for some nights but apparently they couldn't be applied to 7 nights booked in a row!! ) Here's why it wasn't worth the price: There aren't many facilities considering that it's a 2 star hotel. The rooms and lift were very small. My luggage barely fit into the noisy lift, which reminded me of a dumb-waiter. My "double" bed was actually smaller than a queen size because my husband and I could not even turn. It was supposed to be a "superior" room, although I'm not sure if we were actually given one. No kettle in the room but there was an Ipod dock and free wifi which we had to get the password every day. There was NOTHING in the neighborhood and the nearest convenient store was in Pigalle, 10 mins walk away and a red light district. No other shops around.. Streets there were FILTHY and we constantly had to look out for dog poop. Not very pleasant for a holiday. I regret spending almost 2K Euros on this lousy stay and I wish I had gone elsewhere. Will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small, modern hotel with good service and very nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: BerlinSunshine
Reviews.Content: The Joyce Hotel in Paris is a small, very modern hotel. The rooms are small (as mostly in Paris), but very nicely decorated: with designer lamps, comfortable bed, surprisingly nice wall decoration and a nice bathroom. Also the rooms are very clean. Just behind the small lobby is the breakfast and lounge room. The breakfast was simple, but of high quality. The bread was fresh and good and one could chose from e.g. a variety of marmalade, cheese and hot drinks. During day time a complimentary bar with some sweet and salted snacks as well as soft drinks was on offer in this lounge area. We were lucky to book for a very good price (special offer for opening?). In the meantime the room prices have increased. Acces to metro and bike stations just around the corner. 10 minutes walk from Galleries Lafayette.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LuxyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff. Our room was small and comfortable but the shower head did not work properly and the bottom of the shower curtain was moldy (eeww). Reported both to the front desk that morning and was told they would take care of it. Unfortunately they didn't. Breakfast was included and was just OK. For us it was a last minute booking so overall we were pleased. Would we book again? Hmmmm, maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: eamielle
Reviews.Content: We spent a fantastic 3 nights of our honeymoon at the Hotel Joyce and the staff, location and the interior couldn't have been better. Upon arrival we were made to feel very welcome and the staff were very helpful. The location (between Pigalle and St george metro stations) was a great base for wandering with plenty of amenities nearby. The breakfast was pretty good too! The rooms are quite cosy but all finished to a high standard with a ridiculously comfortable bed. I would definately recommend this hotel if you want to treat yourself but can't afford a big fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TAMARAMATA
Reviews.Content: Super clean rooms, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast in the morning was wonderful! The staff here made our trip to Paris more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel and great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Safari21
Reviews.Content: We stayed taw nights with my husband.The hotel was above our expectations.Room was very clean and modern.Hotel lobby was very modern and trendy decorated. The reception staff were very kind and helpful at all times. Complimentary coffee,soft drinks and snacks at the lobby from 2-11pm were really amazing!! Breakfast basic but very good ! The hootel ordered an airport shuttle for us on our check out which was very convenient and cheaper than ordinary taxi fare. We ll definately recommend it and go back in our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Little More Well-Deserved Praise for the Hotel Joyce”
Reviews.Author: ElMusaferain
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Joyce is very close to being the tidy little 3-star hotel of one's dreams - almost all of the great things earlier reviewers have said about it seemed very true for us as well, not least because of a very pleasant surprise upgrade to the sixth-floor suite, which features lovely views across the rooftops of Paris, a separate WC and shower room, and a tremendously comfortable sitting room. The Joyce delivers where it counts: spotlessly clean, excellent mattress and linens, very quiet room (at least where we were), and ample hot water. Our rate included free wifi (in room as well the lobby) and breakfast. The Hotel's many virtues, not least of which its friendly, welcoming staff, offset almost completely the few areas in which one is reminded that it is, after all, a budget choice. Among those are towels, which while of good quality are small, and the breakfast, which comes close to underwhelming (when it's not just being odd - I don't really fancy a cold rice salad at 8:00 in the morning, but perhaps there are those who do...). If the Hotel were to upgrade its croissants and perhaps offer some less sandpaper-like coffee cake, it would be a vast improvement and would better match the excellent coffee and lovely setting. We enjoyed the hotel's little quirks - the infintesimal elevator, the design quirks (the tiny LED lights in the lobby floor work; the white china antlers sprouting seagrass, possibly less so), and the general air of friendliness that prevails. Even more, we appreciated the very caring attitude and support of the desk staff when one of us fell ill on a weekend evening and needed help in getting to the only late-night dental emergency room in Paris. The neighborhood is central enough to be an easy walk to the opera, department stores, and amusingly dodgy Pigalle/Place Clichy district, with longer walks to Montmartre and down to the Louvre quite possible. It's quiet in the evenings, but we still found several nice places open as late as midnight - and the quiet makes for excellent sleep. The Joyce is a Hotel I look forward to recommending to friends and to coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Unique modern style, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RuePerdue
Reviews.Content: The main hall of this hotel is gorgeous. The design is modern and stylish, with a glass roof/wall in the breakfast hall that has an indoor/outdoor feel. In short, cool interior design. I slept comfortably and appreciated the organic bath soaps, but my husband found the room cheapky decorated and woke up with a back ache. There was a flat screen tv and the alarm clock is equipped for an iPhone. Our major complaint was breakfast!! Thawed out croissants, rancid salad, fermented grapefruit! Thank goodness the coffee was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: RGB265
Reviews.Content: It's walking distance from Gare du Nord - perfect for Eurostar. Much nicer area than I had previously thought. I was travelling with my 12 year old son. Extremely friendly staff. Cool and quirky design throughout. Great lobby/eating area - where my son loved the disused car seats, complete with seat-belts - with bonus of free refreshments throughout the day. Bedroom clean and cute design touches. Son also liked the large flat-screen TV. Hot shower. We had a quiet room looking out onto the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: teacher0957
Reviews.Content: Four of us (all female) spent two nights at the Joyce from June 4th to June 6th.. We had planned to stay for three nights but had to cut our trip short becuse of the threat of the Aerlingus strike. We loved the hotel from the moment we stepped inside the door. Like a lot of the other reviews the male staff were super-Kevin and the other person can't remember his name, and then we met another male receptionist on Sunday night who had just started that day-most helpful again. Female receptionist on Monday morning not as nice a little abrupt-met her again later in the evening when we collected our luggage and she was nicer!!! We had twin rooms on the third floor one overlooking the street, the other the courtyard. both were lovely- very comfortable-we loved the rooms. The breakfast was very good-we all enjoyed it and it set us up for the day. The metro St.George and Pigalle are very close to the hotel and make getting around Paris very doable. we had a great few days in Paris and in particular our stay in The Joyce. I would highly recommend The Joyce to anyone visiting Paris-you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull surprise, deffinetly will come back”
Reviews.Author: Valentin_Taciopol
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 nights at Joyce hotel in May 2011 and everything was just lovely, room is confortable and nice, every day cleaning services, a bit small but this is usual for Paris. Breakfast is good and simple, all day you have access free of charge to snacks, coffee, tea, water and juice. Staff is very friendly, always available to help and guide you with information and advices. We are looking forward to come back as we had a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel- Would thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jane271979
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels all over the world I would say it rates as one of the best. It has fantastic decor and is spot on for cleanliness. The staff are extremely friendly and very helfpul with giving information about local events and places of interest. Location is great as it is in very close distance of a metro and all that you need is very close by. Breakfast has a good choice and the addition of continuous snack all day was a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel I've ever stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mei24
Reviews.Content: All staff (who worked at front and cleaning room and more)are so kindly, and helpful. The design of all part of this hotel was modern and very very clean. I feel it's the"Paris"style.But bed spring is too soft for me. In the night, I was necessary to listen to the music to the room next to mine, because the wall of the room is thin. The breakfast, we could have a lot of items not only bread and coffee. there are vegetables and fruits and hams and fresh juices! The place, we could take to OPERA station by walk. very conbinient. this hotel is very comfortable and clean. I'd like to stay again for next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great stay thank you all guys working at front office and reception desk”
Reviews.Author: jazzair
Reviews.Content: Great service, one of the best breakfast, I had in french hotels... Decoration was very simple but thoughtful. Although the rooms were a bit small, Ipod/iphone docks in rooms:) great... Staff was always very helpful... Definitely recommend... Location might be a problem for some of you. But if you use metro, no problem... St.Georges stop is only 300-400mt away from the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Joyce”
Reviews.Author: jklok
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and new. The breakfeast could have more items.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: trisharius
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris. Cool and well-decorated rooms are spacious - by Paris standards. Clean bathroom, and super comfy double bed with lots of pillows! WIFI was fast and never disconnected once, but had to renew passwords with reception on a daily basis. Location was good, near Pigalle and Clichy, and easily accessible to all shopping areas too. I am one person who's very fussy about hotels, and I must say Joyce Hotel has met my standards. I stayed for 5 nights, and every night was as pleasant as it could get. I requested for a room with a balcony upon internet booking, and was pleased as a punch when they accomodated my request and allocated me one. I agree with the other travellers; the best gem about the hotel is the staff.. especially the male staff - very helpful and spoke perfect english. Free breakfast was also a plus, and the spread was good. Price point is good for what you get - not too expensive nor cheap. Keep the rates this way please. TOTALLY loved my stay there, and will surely book them again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Joyce is perfect for anyone wanting a clean, cost effective and comfortable place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: beachmaven2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took our once-in-a-lifetime trip to Paris and left the men at home so that we could shop, go to museums and just do those things we can't when they're with us. I saw Hotel Joyce mentioned in Travel and Leisure magazine and decided to try it. What a perfect choice! Affordable, immaculate, nice breakfasts, great neighborhood, wonderful staff (especially Samuel who went out of his way to help us with excursions), convenient to everything. Young people will particularly enjoy staying here - young couples, young travelers, young families. Older, more traveled people might find some of the accommodations not as luxurious as they want (no frills, not much room in the bathroom, no comfortable sitting chair, small towels, stuff like that). But my daughter and I spent so little time in the room, it didn't matter to us. VERY TINY ELEVATOR, and the staircase is circular, so in the event of an emergency, it might be difficult for elderly people to get out quickly. One small complaint - there's no electrical outlet in the bathroom (usual in Europe) but it would be helpful if there was a mirror near the outlet in the bedroom. If you stay here, bring a travel mirror with you if you need to use a curling iron. Other than that, it's a great hotel. We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great find - wonderful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RamoGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to Pigalle and it's a comfortable walk to Montmarte and the Sacre Coeur. It's a short walk to Opera and all the major stores around there. It's also handy for several Metro stations, putting all the major attractions within easy reach. The rooms, which not huge, are spacious by Paris standards and are very stylish and comfortable. The public rooms are also very stylishly decorated - tres chic! Breakfast in the hotel is a treat - lots of choice and plenty to go round. The immediate area itself is mainly residential, making a good night's sleep easy to come by, and there are some nice neighbourhood restaurants close by where we were the only tourists. We would recommend Bistro Lorette and Bistro Deux Theatres. The best thing about this hotel, though, is the staff. They all speak outstanding English and have great knowledge of the immediate area and Paris in general. They're a real feather in the hotel's cap. I wouldn't hesitate to return and I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, 3 Stars hotel for the price of 2 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: Paipaishu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a total of 6 nights in this hotel. About 300m to St Georges Station (underground train station), plenty of restaurants around especially Japansese restaurants. Although hotel room is rather small, definitely clean and neat, but we thought it is the standard in Paris! Bathroom amenities include organic shampoo and shower gel. Room was cleaned on the daily basis. Good variety of TV channels. Nevertheless, the free buffet breakfast for the month of February 2011 was a plus. Good variety breakfast. The all day snack also provided with plenty of Perrier mineral water supplied! Male reception staffs was more helpful and courteous than female staff! I strongly encouraged you to book the hotel via the hotel website as it is often cheaper to do so. (astotel.com) We were offered a 20% cheaper rate for a min of 3 nights stay. All in all, We would definitely go back to this hotel in the future. Mr. & Mrs Yong - Selangor, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “immaculate Hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Kenno3045
Reviews.Content: I still remembered when we arrive at Paris on 10 April. Tired and exhausted with all our luggages going down and up the stairs within the train station, we were calmed by the excellent reception staff, Colene. The first time that anyone has ever say to me on vacation. 'Relax you are on holiday. Don't worry we make sure your stay is a pleasant one'. My wife and I were overwhelmed! We had the biggest surprise right before all eyes when we enter room 402. It was absolutely glorious! I probably have not stayed in a room so beautiful and cosy in my life before! My wife was overlooked. Everything else were good - Breakfast, Free Internet access, information, quiet,clean etc. The only feedback I've got is the hotel should really consider a shower curtain for the bathroom as the small panel of glass is not enough to block the water from splashing out when you shower. At the end of the shower, the bathroom gets very wet. That said, we are very very happy with our stay in this hotel and would love to come back again. Paris is amazing! And so is Joyce Hotel! Merci! - Ken and Fion, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AnnetaT
Reviews.Content: This is a very home friendly hotel where the service is excellent. The rooms are small but really cozy and warm, the only thing that indicates that it really is a hotel is that when you return after your walks, someone else has cleaned everything for you! There is free internet access which is very important. The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast which was a bit boring, but on the other hand, baguettes are a must in Paris! It is also within walking distance from many attractions such as the Opera. There is also a metro station less than 2 minutes away. So I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planing to visit this city, as it has great service, a cozy feeling and has a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: TandNomi
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience! Thank you Samuel for your impeccable service and dedication to making our stay in Paris the best experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. We will definitely stay at this place again. Thank you from Nomi and Theresa - USA.

Reviews.Title: “Would gladly return!”
Reviews.Author: MarkPetko
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Joyce. The hotel is clean, comfortable, accommodating and a good value. The most notable attribute is the the staff. Multi-lingual and always warm and helpful. Everyone we came into contact with was pleasant but we were especially helped by Colene and Hatem. It seems that whomever is managing/hiring really knows how important quality personalities are in this business. The hotel itself is in a great neighborhood, away from touristy crowds and seems to be an authentic Paris experience. The Metro is very close and easy to access to get to anywhere in the city and would recommend for everyday getting around. I would agree with a previous review to skip taking the Metro from Gard de Nord upon arrival. Spend the money on a taxi as lugging our bags trrough the train station, to La Chapele metro, to the hotel was a bit trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rima2011
Reviews.Content: Clean, well decorated rooms. Extremelly pleasant and helpful people on reception. Free coffee/tea/softs/snacks in the lobby. Great location (5 min to metro, 20 min walking to Montmartre). It's was a real pleasure to stay in this hotel. Only one "-": free wi-fi but you should update login each 24h :) Rima

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: T0J
Reviews.Content: A pleasant design-type hotel, in an area which is close both to Montmartre and the theatre/opera district. Reception staff was friendly and spoke English well (although I also speak French, their English was better). You can walk downtown if you like, if not the metro station St. Georges is only a short walk away. If you arrive at Gare du Nord, though, you might as well consider taking a taxi as the metro connection from there involves plenty of stairs and long corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but a little expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: Free75spirit
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a birthday surprise for my husband. The location was good n the staff very friendly especially Kevin and Hadan. It would have been nice to get a choice of a hot breakfast as eating bread can get a bit boring for 4 mornings!! The only downfall was the price. It was more of a 3* but the price reflected a 4*+. I would say that a price of around £80-90 would seem more reasonable. Overall we had a wonderful time in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect affordable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliverhsg
Reviews.Content: Rooms were comfortable, stylish, and in great condition. Service is friendly, if a little spacey. Stayed here for a long weekend and found the location and amenities to be perfect. Great location close to rue des Martyres (for foodies) and Pigalle & St. Georges metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Comfortable, amicable”
Reviews.Author: abu_ayyash
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel, it's classified as 3 stars but found the service better than 4 starts in some other hotels..friendly, helpful people..comfortable beds..clean

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike-of-MOW
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It's brand new, immaculately clean, has a very pleasant design, the staff is very helpful and friendly. Free wifi is very reliable and fast. The bed is not very wide, but the matress is good and there is a choice of pillows. The wardrobe is roomy and has plenty of hangers in it. There are just 3 minor disadvantages: not enough water pressure in the shower, the scent used for the toiletries, the breakfasts are a little bit too basic. The overall impression is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel Joyce!”
Reviews.Author: wtreviews
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Joyce at 7am and although check in was not until 2pm we were warmly welcomed, invited to sit in their dinging room and given cappuccinos. The room was very clean and exactly as it appeared in the website photos. The bedroom and bed itself were perhaps a little small, but in general the room was very comfortable. Its modern yet has character and charm, it has a very Parisian feel to it. The location was extremely convenient, it’s a short walk to a major shopping area, metro station, L’open tour stop, and the Moulin Rouge. A little further but still an easy walk is the Champs Elysses. Most inner city cab rides were under 10 euros. There are a handful of restuarants very close by, we recommend L’Aromatik for affordable modern French cuisine. There is also an Italian restaurant two doors down that serves a good Lasanga. The free breakfast and daily snacks are not elaborate but fresh and very enjoyable, a great way to start the day before venturing out to explore the beautiful city. TV only has a couple of English news channels and the room service menu is quite limited and from our one experience not very good. Wifi is free and fast, although requires a new password every 24 hours which is a little tedious. During our stay no request was too much trouble for the staff, they really went over and above to satisfy our needs. Highly recommend Hotel Joyce!

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel with lovely design and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kukulik
Reviews.Content: i usually don't write reviews on the hotels,but staying in this one was so joyful,that i just had to do it! everything was wanderful!the fresh croissants at the breakfast,very modern,interesting, yet not overwhelming design ,really nice location,close to grand magasins(so really good for those,who want to do some shopping) and grand opera. and of course the nicest people on the reception!especially Liam(if i am not mistaken),who has helped us alot at not getting late to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lisjlyons
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Joyce for 10 nights for my recent honeymoon. This was a fantastic choice for us - the location was great - easy to walk to Mont Marte, Opera, Gallery La Fayette and we even walked to the Louvre from here. The staff are extremly helpful in offering advise and suggestions on places to see and eat and the breakfast provided each morning was simple but just what you needed to get you started on a full day sight seeing. The only critisism I would have was the rooms are rather small but if you are in Paris to see all the sights you wont be spending too much time in the room! It also has free Wi-Fi.....which we found very useful to plan our next days adventures! Would highly recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, central location, amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca186402
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a two-night stay in Hotel Joyce and the fact that I'm actually getting around to writing a review shows how impressed I was! I went with my friend for a city break from London and we paid £84 per night for a twin room. Even after reading the reviews on here I was dubious that a hotel in Paris could be that good, especially for that price. But honestly once you step in the front door you're bound to start smiling! The design is really quirky and I loved the attention to detail that ran through the whole hotel. The room was spacious, had a good tv and an ipod docking station. The bathroom was large by any standards, which for Paris means it was huge! They offer free drinks and snacks all afternoon and evening and the free breakfast was very good. I lived in Paris a few years ago and I can assure you the location is fantastic. My friend and I wandered around joking that we'd have to find something negative to say about Hotel Joyce but in all honesty we couldn't think of a single thing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, small hotel in excellent location. Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Reeka2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Joyce Hotel for 5 nights on our first visit to Paris. We speak only the basics of the French language, and the never had an issue communicating with any hotel staff, as they spoke English. They allowed us to check in very early after an exhausting overnight flight, and they answered questions and made dinner reservations for us. Very pleasant and made our stay very comfortable. The hotel itself is new, and it feels new (vs. a janky renovation.) It is beautiful and light and clean. The design is so thoughtful. It is small and easy. There is no restaurant or bar, but the breakfast area is so bright and nice. The free breakfast (if you can get it) is a GREAT deal - baguette and croissants, fruit, meat and cheese, dry cereal, coffee and juice. The rooms are not too small - plenty of room for us and our gear. Really great beds, clean spacious bathrooms, and again, plenty of light. We loved that we could have a window open all day/night to get fresh air. Our room overlooked the courtyard and had a decent view, being on the 4th floor. Free wifi was a nice bonus. Nice TVs and iPod docking station/speakers, also bonuses. The neighborhood was perfect for us. The hotel is on a very quiet street, but is within 10 minutes (on foot) of Montmartre - lots of bars and restaurants, plenty to see and do. The hotel is 2 blocks from a metro station, also. I would love to stay here again, should we return to Paris, and would very much recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates a unique and beautiful building, well designed rooms, quiet, kind staff, all of these things. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: csc1818
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Joyce for three nights in mid-October. It's not right in the center of Paris but as NYers, we're used to walking everywhere anyway! It really helped us see the entire city and it was nice at the end of the night to have a more "neighborhood" feel. Subways and buses were super-easy to access but we walked a LOT! The hotel was incredibly clean with adorable rooms that were very comfortable with just enough space for two. Breakfast was fine - nothing special but all you really need is a criossant anyway! We'd definitely stay here again, great value at about $200 US a night.

Reviews.Title: “Joyce Hotel made our anniversary trip the treat we'd hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming13
Reviews.Content: Joyce hotel is a superbly clean and comfortable hotel and we found it ideally situated for our needs ie Pompidou, Louvre, Opera Bastille. St Georges and Pigalle metro stops are both nearby and we walked when the sun shone. We loved our room, so very quiet and comfortable. Cleanliness exceptional and breakfast plentiful. Hot drinks available whenever we wanted them. We ate at two lovely restaurants, one a short walk away Les Coulises and one in the Bourse - Les Fines Geules Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Joyce!”
Reviews.Author: Pattons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Joyce for seven nights. It was a very modern, new hotel with great design and details. The staff was helpful. The food was good. The room was great. We look forward to staying there again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmy9
Reviews.Content: I like very much the rooms and their beds are extremely comfortable.service at reception is very professional.only thing breakfast is not that special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnnD6
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel, nice decor and our room was spotless. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but close to the metro. Our only disappointment was with the restaurant recommendation from the front desk. She sent us to a tourist trap restaurant several blocks away, but we should have known that when she gave us a pre-printed card to give to the maitre'd.

Reviews.Title: “I found my favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: superusta
Reviews.Content: I read about Joyce Hotel in October issue of "Travel+Leisure" magazine, and booked this hotel thru Expedia for about 180 euro per night. For the first two nights in Paris, I booked a boutique hotel designed by Christian Lacroix right behind Musee D'Orsey but was disappointing, so I was anxious to see Joyce Hotel, but Joyce Hotel totally made our Paris trip very special! When we got there I was thrilled to see such hip and unique designed hotel. We stayed at room# 304, and was big and had good amount of natural light from 3 big windows. I was worried about the sound from the street, but was quiet enough that I could sleep well at night. Bathroom was nice and the beds were very comfy. I loved the corky decore!! It was really close to Pigalle station and we walked around Montmare all day. I love Montmare.... The breakfast was very nice and all-day you can eat bar was perfect when we got back to the hotel to rest from long day. Service was great as the stuff were friendly. I would def come back to this hotel next time when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good staff, a bit of an identity crisis”
Reviews.Author: alexinparis
Reviews.Content: There are times when interestingly designed hotels really work, the trouble is that by taking this approach your really exposing yourself to scrutiny and in the case of hotel joyce I would say there is probably a bit too much going on! to the extent where the mixture of expensive designer peices and obviuously cheap fabrications doesnt really work so looks a bit gimiky and a touch fake. The hotel is in a great location and is very clean and compact, the bathrooms are nice and its very clean for paris standards, its not cheap but I think relatively reasonable for what you get in comparision to other hotels. The breakfast is good and the staff are really really good, again especially for Paris when you can get some real arseholes. We stayed in a ground floor room the first night and it was noisy as hell, the room was good but the reception is the other side of the wall and the toilet for the lobby is right next to the bedroom door so if your a light sleeper avoid at all costs, the second night we moved to the top floor which was quite a small room but very quiet. Overall pretty decent though.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay in beautifully styled hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElisaLein
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed in this well styled and clean hotel. Rooms are very pleasant and though stylish functionality comes first. Breakfast is excellent and the staff friendly and willing to help. We definetely recommend this hotel, especially for couples on a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff we've ever met”
Reviews.Author: Gunnel2
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly our stay in Paris seemed to be a bit longer than we had planned. The Ash Cloud cancelled all flights if you remember. Work obligations waited at home but it seemed impossible to find a way out of Paris. Thanks to really helpful and kind staff at Joyce Hotel we finally found a car to rent. No efforts were spared. Throughout they were helpful and patient. And the hotel was lovely - clean, nice design and situated close to everything. But the staff! They couldn't be better. Next time in Paris - this hotel is our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a room for my birthday but they overbooked and tried to put us somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jonica23
Reviews.Content: I had read great things about this hotel, so happily booked it for my birthday weekend. They apparently overbooked and tried to send us about 200 meters to a partner hotel (Hotel George). After a long work day, a long train ride, a taxi there and just wanting to relax on a Friday night before a late dinner, I couldn't believe they would think this partner hotel was anything like Hotel Joyce. It was old, smelly, and they attempted to put us in a small room with two twin beds. I'm not one to complain (or even write a review for that matter), but this was unacceptable. Even the guy at the front desk was embarrassed. We ended up walking and finding a hotel on our own. Complete disappointment with Hotel Joyce and how they handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent renovated 'design' hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: garryDC
Reviews.Content: The Joyce is a new (renovated?) 3-star hotel on the boundary between Opéra and Montmartre. A modern 'design' establishment with very competitive prices (around €100 a night). The rooms are well equipped and sufficient for a 3-4 day visit (for a longer stay, you need a little extra space). Having said that, we have stayed in luxury hotels in Paris with smaller rooms... Sound-proofing is good. Bathroom has a large shower, no bath. Air conditioning worked well and not noisy. If you have a room on the courtyard side, you can sleep with the windows open. Staff were helpful and friendly both at reception and in the breakfast room (a glass-covered area in the courtyard). The buffet breakfast was very good: excellent baguettes, good coffee and tea, fruit, yoghurt etc. Until the end of 2010, breakfast is free. The room stays open 24hrs a day for hot & cold drinks. Access is good: via the St Georges and Pigalle metro stations. If you're not too happy about the more colourful side of Pigalle, use the St. Georges station at night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and could very happily have stayed longer. The hotel is very individual with its quirky decor but that's part of its charm - it has retained it's original features but decorated in an unusual way. You really have to see it ! Cleanliness of the rooms and public areas is obviously a priority and everywhere was spotless - you could have eaten off the floor!! A huge mention must be made of the service from the staff. They are an absolute credit to the company - all so very helpful and friendly. Although there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, there is an open free bar for drinks and snacks like peanuts,crisps and little cakes. This really is a truly free bar. We had the buffet breakfast and it was excellent for setting you up for the day ahead. There were all manner of cold breakfast items and a plentiful supply of tea,coffee etc. Location-wise, the hotel is situated between the Opera and Montmartre and within strolling distance of the main streets. We are limited in our walking stamina and speed due to medical ailments but managed to go to a lot of places if we took our time. A metro station is just at the end of the street so very handy. This was a perfect hotel and I would visit Paris again just to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ssureal
Reviews.Content: Likes Location is near the metro and 7 mins walk to Opera area or moulin Rouge Near nice restaurants,supermarkets Quaint neighbourhood Hotel is new and very well designed and furnished Staff were friendly Free high speed internet Free open bar and breakfast Rooms were reasonable in size Dislikes Seats were too crammped during breakfast Housekeeping will make up your room despite the 'Do not distrub' sign

Reviews.Title: “A nice hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: virgodoc
Reviews.Content: The Joyce Hotel is steps away from a metro station, a short stroll to the Moulin Rouge and Montmarte! This hotel is in a great location, the price was excellent, staff courteous and helpful and the rooms were a real treat. The beds were very comfortable, particularly after Trans-Atlantic flights. The hotel and guest rooms were decorated in a tasty and modern motif. I definitely recommend this hotel for both leisure and business travel

Reviews.Title: “very nice and original hotel”
Reviews.Author: maudtie
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel during a very hot weekend in July, very happy with the airco ;-) I really liked this hotel, because it is so different from standard hotels. A lot of original details in the lobby, breakfast room but also in the rooms. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was good, not the typical Paris breakfast wilh only croissants and jam. Two streets away from the hotel we found a lovely little square with all kinds of restaurants and caf'es. I would love to go back to hotel Joyce and can recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Chic”
Reviews.Author: wildwesterly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Joyce is clean, comfortable and chic. Staff are friendly, youthful and very helpful. We were given a complimentary walking/Metro map and a little guide book on arrival and were able to leave our luggage in storage until check-in time. There is an open bar 24 hours if you need a hot or cold drink. We stayed in Room 301, a twin room, headboards are decorated with architectural drawings mimicking a library, the wardrobe has felt-like doors and an easy to use safe. My teenage daughter was thrilled with the ipod dock! Pastel shades and lots of mirrors, we loved the moveable magnifying makeup/shaving mirror in the bathroom. Great black-out curtains if you need an afternoon nap from all that walking around Paris. Saint-Georges is the closest Metro station, 5 minutes walk away and Rue de Martrys lined with wonderful gourmet food shops including Arnaud Delmontel’s beautiful bakery is a few minutes walk beyond that. A 15 minute walk to Galeries Lafayette and the Opera House. This Hotel is great for a long weekend/week discovering Paris where you require little more than friendly service, a quiet comfortable rest and a refreshing hot shower in between excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris. Very nicely...”
Reviews.Author: macsla
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Paris. Very nicely decorated bedrooms of decent size. Quiet rooms on the courtyard. Location OK. The staff is amazing. Friendly, efficient and Very helpful. Rare...
